importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The series begins in the 1930s, a pivotal era in American political and social history, which provides historical context for the rise of the Kennedy dynasty and the shaping of modern American political culture.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The narrative of the series spans from 1917 to 1956, covering key formative years of the Kennedy family, including the births and early lives of major figures such as Joe Kennedy, Sr., Jack Kennedy, and other children, during which the American political landscape was rapidly evolving.

keyTakeAways: Netflix is releasing a new drama series titled 'Kennedy' based on Fredrik Logevall's book 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
Michael Fassbender stars as Joe Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy family, in the series.
The series explores both the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family, including the legacy of political ambition and personal loss.
The show begins in the 1930s and traces the rise of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, with a focus on Jack Kennedy's struggle to escape the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy.

The showrunner, Sam Shaw, describes the Kennedy story as a reflection of American mythology and a nuanced look into how the family's experiences mirror broader American historical and cultural developments.
The series is distinct from a planned Ryan Murphy-produced show about JFK Jr. and will consist of eight episodes.
It does not yet have a release date.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy family
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An influential American political dynasty that includes U.S. Presidents John F. Kennedy and Robert F. Kennedy, as well as other prominent political and social figures.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Kennedy family is a central subject of the series, with the show dramatizing their rise, struggles, and tragic events, making them a symbol of American political ambition and legacy.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A renowned British actor known for his roles in films such as 'The Machinist', 'Tyrannosaur', and 'The Social Network'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fassbender is cast as Joe Kennedy, Sr., bringing his acclaimed acting credentials to a high-profile historical drama, enhancing the show's appeal to global audiences.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An American historian and author known for his biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His book serves as the primary source material for the series, providing historical depth and authenticity to the narrative.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The showrunner of the new 'Kennedy' series on Netflix.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Shaw is responsible for developing the show’s narrative structure and thematic direction, emphasizing the human dimension behind the Kennedy mythos.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A global streaming platform that offers original content across genres, including drama and historical programming.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netflix is producing and announcing the series, indicating its interest in historical and cultural content that appeals to international audiences.

namedEntities.name: John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The 35th U.S. President, born into the Kennedy family, and a central figure in American history.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His presidency and legacy are part of the broader Kennedy family narrative, which the show explores through historical and familial lens.

namedEntities.name: Robert F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A U.S. Senator and presidential hopeful, also a member of the Kennedy family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His political ambitions and tragic death are included in the series' depiction of the Kennedy family’s tragedies and struggles.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The son of John F. Kennedy, who died in a plane crash in 1999 along with his wife and sister-in-law.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His death is referenced as part of the Kennedy family’s tragic history, reinforcing the idea of a 'Kennedy curse' and contributing to the series' emotional tone.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prominent television producer known for shows such as 'American Horror Story' and 'The Queen’s Gambit'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ryan Murphy is noted as the producer of a different upcoming show about JFK Jr., which distinguishes the new Netflix series from that project.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new historical drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956.' The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and follows the rise and struggles of the Kennedy family from the 1930s through the 1950s. It explores both their political triumphs and personal tragedies, including the deaths of Robert F. Kennedy and JFK Jr., and the burden of familial legacy. The show is described as a nuanced exploration of American mythology and history, developed by showrunner Sam Shaw, and will consist of eight episodes. It is distinct from a planned Ryan Murphy series about JFK Jr. and has not yet been released.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
